channel.title: Help perventing ::Noclip and make ::master for mods
channel.description: Okay what can i do to stop people from using ::noclip exept owner. and make master for mods and admins.

item.title: Help perventing ::Noclip and make ::master for mods
item.dc:creator: @o.O_O.o o.O O.o
item.description:
@o.O_O.o wrote:

!= gravedigger?

NO.

So this is not spam, make sure it’s in the customCommand method [;

Read full topic

item.source: Help perventing ::Noclip and make ::master for mods

item.title: Help perventing ::Noclip and make ::master for mods
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“xx qwertyuiop xx, post:8, topic:274655”][quote author=o.O O.o link=topic=362863.msg2757164#msg2757164 date=1240275521]

if (command.StartsWith("noclip") && (!playerRights = 3))) { sM("you need to be an owner to noclip");

For some reason I want to strongly suggest using && playerRights != 3)

Damn qwerty, beat me to it.
[/quote]
If you do !playerRights it assumes you’re checking the value of playerRights which is inferred as a boolean because of the ! in front of it (which will result in an error because playerRights is an integer). You’d need to use brackets to do it that way.

if (command.startsWith("noclip") && !(playerRights == 3)) { etc. [/quote]
Or playerRights != 3;

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("noclip") && playerName != YOUR NAME) { outStream.createFrame(109);
I think that’s what you want.

Read full topic
item.source: Help perventing ::Noclip and make ::master for mods

@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

[quote=“o.O O.o, post:7, topic:274655”][quote author=deathschaos9 link=topic=362863.msg2757147#msg2757147 date=1240274488]

if (command.StartsWith("noclip") && (!playerRights = 3))) { sM("you need to be an owner to noclip");
[/quote]

For some reason I want to strongly suggest using && playerRights != 3)

Damn qwerty, beat me to it.[/quote]
If you do !playerRights it assumes you’re checking the value of playerRights which is inferred as a boolean because of the ! in front of it (which will result in an error because playerRights is an integer). You’d need to use brackets to do it that way.

if (command.startsWith("noclip") && !(playerRights == 3)) {
etc.

For some reason I want to strongly suggest using && playerRights != 3)

Damn qwerty, beat me to it.

item.title: Help perventing ::Noclip and make ::master for mods

[quote=“deathschaos9, post:5, topic:274655”] if (command.StartsWith("noclip") && (!playerRights = 3))) { sM("you need to be an owner to noclip");
same bases for ::master[/quote]
what

if (command.toLowerCase().startsWith("noclip") && playerRights < 3) {
    outStream.createFrame(109);
}

Read full topic
